alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Garfield; Holt (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 11 at 2:09PM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 PM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM FRIDAY TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches with locally higher amounts possible. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from now until Noon CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to 6 PM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM Friday to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and strong winds will create dangerously low wind chill values. This will result in frostbite and lead to hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken. A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frostbite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
